revised_title: Advancements in Understanding Body Temperature and Fever: A Decade in Review
tldr: This article discusses the changes in understanding body temperature and fever over the past decade. It highlights the shift from viewing the hypothalamus as a thermostat to recognizing it as a complex system that maintains the body's'milieu interieur'. The author explores the roles of monoamines, prostaglandins, and ions in temperature regulation and their effects on fever. The article also emphasizes the importance of studying the biological processes underlying temperature regulation in living tissue.
